newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran accuses Iraq of ceasefire violations.
newsitem.headline: Iran accuses Iraq of ceasefire violations.

text.p: Iran has accused Iraq of violating the ceasefire that ended their 1980-88 war 21 times between the end of May and June 27, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said on Wednesday.
Iran's representative to the United Nations, Kamal Kharrazi, alleged the violations in a letter to U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros Ghali, the agency said.
Violations included shooting towards Iranian territory, installing mortars and constructing observation posts, it said.

It said Tehran also alleged shooting on June 16 on an Iranian post at the southern end of the Iran-Iraq border by "anti-revolutionary elements", an apparent reference to the Iraq-based Mujahideen Khalq armed opposition group.
Iran and Iraq regularly report violations of the U.N.-sponsored ceasefire which ended their eight-year war.
